title: Job & employment scams (easy money / quick hiring)
summary: Job scams promise easy work-from-home income but aim to steal your money or get you to move money for them.
how_it_works: They offer high pay for little effort and a fast ‘hiring’ process.
They may ask you to top up accounts with your own money/crypto to ‘complete tasks’.
warning_signs: No real interview or reference checks.
You must pay money or crypto to ‘unlock’ work/tasks.
Recruiter uses encrypted messaging and urgency.
example_hooks: “Top up your account to finish tasks and withdraw.”
what_to_do: Don’t pay to get a job.
Verify the company independently (official site, ABN, real contact).
Report suspicious job ads and messages.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
